data.title: The 15 best photo spots in Mahabaleshwar

placeMetadata.name: Venna Lake

sources.snippet: Set against the picturesque backdrop of Mahabaleshwar, Venna Lake is a man-made lake just 2 kilometers from the heart of the city. It was built in 1842 by the ruler of Satara Shri Appasaheb Maharaj - a descendant of Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj, to ensure a regular supply of water to the nearby town. Constructed over a sprawling 28 acres, the lake has a periphery of 7 to 8 km.
sources.shortName: 26 Best Places to Visit in Mahabaleshwar

sources.snippet: The lake offers rowboats, and paddleboats ride to the visitors and hence is usually very crowded. There is horse riding and rides for children such as merry go round and the toy train. There are a number of eateries around the lake famous for street food like corn, bhelpuri and fresh fruits like mulberries, strawberries and carrots.
sources.shortName: 31 Best Places to visit in Mahabaleshwar | Top Tourist Attractions

sources.snippet: Tapola, Pratapgad, Lingamala Falls, Venna Lake, Mapro Garden, Elephant‚Äôs Head Point, Lodwick Point, Rajpuri Caves, Table Land, Connaught Peak,  Mahabaleshwar Temple, Babington Point, Parsi Point, Morarji Castle, and many other tourist attractions.
sources.shortName: 20 Places to Visit in Mahabaleshwar in One Day: 2025

sources.snippet: Make a symbolic video about John Abraham‚Äôs vigilante attitude, or use the beautiful atmosphere of the lake for a calm pre-wedding photo shoot. This gorgeous location is ideal for shooting a moving music video or stunning landscape shots.
sources.shortName: 12 Mesmerizing Mahabaleshwar Locations for Your Next Shoot

sources.snippet: Venna Lake is among the most scenic places to go to in Mahabaleshwar. It was initially constructed to cater to the town‚Äôs water requirements. The lake also offers a few pilgrimage spots submerged within 1-2 km.
sources.shortName: Top Tourist Destinations to Visit in Mahabaleshwar

sources.snippet: Situated near the Venna Lake, this small garden is a great place chill out after enjoying boat rides at the lake. Surrounded by plants and flowers, there are comfortable benches and a few slides for kids.
sources.shortName: 20 Breathtaking Places to Visit in Mahabaleshwar

sources.snippet: Surrounded by the dense greenery on each of the lake‚Äôs side. Venna lake is the top places to visit in Mahabaleshwar. This man-made lake was built by Raja of Satara, Shri Appasaheb Maharaj.
sources.shortName: Best Places to Visit in Mahabaleshwar

sources.snippet: Built by Shri Appasaheb Maharaj in 1942, Venna Lake stretches across eight kilometers. Tourists come here to enjoy boat rides, horse rides, and snacks at the many eateries.
sources.shortName: 43 Places to Visit in Mahabaleshwar in 2024
Things To Do | Exclusive Mahabaleshwar Site (2025)
40 Places To Visit In Mahabaleshwar For The Holiday Of A Lifetime

placeMetadata.description: Lake recreation area with boats available to rent, horseback rides & carnival-style food stalls.
placeMetadata.generatedDescription: Venna Lake is a delightful recreational spot nestled in the picturesque Mahabaleshwar region of Maharashtra. This stunning lake offers an array of activities for visitors, including boat rentals that allow you to glide across its serene waters. For those seeking adventure on land, horseback rides are available, providing a unique way to explore the surrounding natural beauty. The area is also dotted with vibrant food stalls serving carnival-style treats, making it a perfect place to relax and indulge after a day of exploration.

reviews.reviewText: It is one of the most scenic attractions in Mahabaleshwar. Beautiful lake surrounded by hills. Great for boat rides while watching the sunset. We went during May end , so the evening breeze by the lake was so soothing. Gets extremely crowded during peak tourist season. There are ample parking spots, but due to the rush of tourists, it is very difficult to find a parking spot nearby. I have seen families walk a considerable distance from their parking area to reach the lake. It all depends upon whether you get a parking or not , if you have a driver, they may drop you at a distance. Apart from this, the lake vicinity has different activities like boat riding , horse riding, etc, and way too many fast food joints selling all kinds of food and drinks. There are fruit vendors , toy vendors , and so many shop keepers all around. If you just want to sit by the lake and watch the sunset amidst all the cacophony , come a bit early and sit a little away from the main entrance point.
Saturday evening was very pleasant like winter due to temperature dip. It was blissful, refreshing. Enjoyed 1 hr peddle boat ride in cold and breathtaking view of sunset

Rates are little high for boating like 600/- for half an hour. Everything is costly here, all eatables, small games, etc. Good lake which provides drinking water to MAHABALESHWAR. Evening weather is good with fog for boating.

This lake is very beautiful. It would have been much better if there was no rain and fog. Boat ride was thrilling and the fun filled horse riding with my son. Plenty of stalls for street food like corn, tea, etc‚Ä¶

This lake is 90 feet deep. If you‚Äôre visiting with just two people and want to go for a boat ride, I highly recommend opting for a speedboat, which costs around ‚Çπ800 for 6 people and 1 child for 30 minutes. The price is fixed regardless of whether you‚Äôre 2, 3, or 6 people. Be cautious of scammers in the area ‚Äì they may offer to arrange for 3-4 other people to join, but they‚Äôll charge more than the actual price and won‚Äôt provide tickets. Remember, when you buy tickets, insurance is included, so if there‚Äôs any accident , the boat service management won‚Äôt be held responsible.

Venna Lake is an ideal combination of nature, leisure, and light adventure, making it a must-see destination for families, couples, and solo visitors. There is no entry cost; you only pay for activities like as boats and rides. A tranquil lakeside surrounded by green hills, ideal for wandering, photography, and relaxing. Plenty of parking accessible near the entrance.

It is very beautiful lake in the middle of Mahabaleshwar. I went in the monsoon season and lake was full of water. You can do boating here and visit a beautiful Hanuman temple located in one corner of the lake.

Venna lake is a huge lake popular for boating, bird watching.
Shri Appasaheb Maharaj constructed the venna lake for the drinking and agricultural purpose. Tourists should strictly follow the rules made by venna lake management while boating and roaming around the lake.

Things to enjoy are -
1. Bird watching ( birds like egrets, herons, kingfisher are mostly seen here, specially during winter season )
2. Paddle Boating , Rowing
3. Horse riding is available
4. Beautiful selfie points are available
5. Roasted corn , baby carrots, strawberries, mulberry and many other fruits , veggies are available, select fruits carefully and avoid buying artificially ripen fruits

placeMetadata.name: Elephants Head Point

sources.snippet: Known as the "Queen of All Points", Arthur Seat Point is one of the most famous and mesmerizing viewpoints in Mahabaleshwar. Perched at an altitude of 1,470 meters, this stunning spot offers breathtaking panoramic views of the deep valleys, the Savitri River, and the surrounding rugged mountains. What makes this location unique is its floating effect, if you throw light objects like a cap or paper, they appear to float due to the air pressure difference.
sources.shortName: Top 20 Places to visit in Mahabaleshwar

sources.snippet: Elephant‚Äôs Head Point is named after the natural rock formation of the extended ridge at the far end of the Sahyadri mountain range. It‚Äôs shape resembles an elephant head and trunk and is the best vantage point in Mahabaleshwar offering panoramic views of the serene valley and mountains around it.
sources.shortName: 26 Best Places to Visit in Mahabaleshwar

sources.snippet: Elephant‚Äôs Head Point is a renowned vantage point in Mahabaleshwar. It is a perfect place for enjoying a picnic place in Mahabaleshwar together with your family and friends. True to its title, the place bears an uncanny similarity to the head and back of an elephant.
sources.shortName: Top Tourist Destinations to Visit in Mahabaleshwar

sources.snippet: Key attractions : Lodwick Point area has 2 points in total viz Lodwick Point and Elephant Head Point. General Lodwick was the first British officer to climb the hill. To honour General Lodwick's achievement, his son erected a memorial pole of about 25 ft.
sources.shortName: Things To Do | Exclusive Mahabaleshwar Site (2025)

sources.snippet: Tapola, Pratapgad, Lingamala Falls, Venna Lake, Mapro Garden, Elephant‚Äôs Head Point, Lodwick Point, Rajpuri Caves, Table Land, Connaught Peak,  Mahabaleshwar Temple, Babington Point, Parsi Point, Morarji Castle, and many other tourist attractions.
sources.shortName: 20 Places to Visit in Mahabaleshwar in One Day: 2025

sources.snippet: Elephant's Head Point, also known as Elphinstone Point is a very popular viewpoint in Mahabaleshwar. The place is perfect to have fun with your family and friends. It's one of the best Mahabaleshwar points, you'll see.
sources.shortName: Best Places to Visit in Mahabaleshwar

sources.snippet: A portion of the hill looks like an elephant‚Äôs trunk, but that is not how this point got its name. It is named after Sir Mount Elphinstone, who served as the Governor of Bombay during the British Raj.
sources.shortName: 20 Breathtaking Places to Visit in Mahabaleshwar

sources.snippet: Elephant Head point also called as Elphinstone Point is literally in the shape of an Elephant's head. You'll be left breath taken by the majestic beauty of this place.
sources.shortName: 15 Stunning Places To Visit In Mahabaleshwar You Should Visit If Youre A Nature Lover

sources.snippet: A popular tourist spot, people come here to enjoy the unique greenery surrounding the rock formations that accurately resemble an elephant's head.
sources.shortName: 43 Places to Visit in Mahabaleshwar in 2024

placeMetadata.generatedDescription: Elephants Head Point is a must-visit destination for anyone exploring Mahabaleshwar, especially for those who appreciate nature and photography. This remarkable viewpoint, named for its striking rock formation that resembles an elephant's head and trunk, stands at an impressive elevation of over 1,500 meters. From this vantage point, visitors are treated to breathtaking panoramic views of the expansive Sahyadri mountain ranges that seem to stretch endlessly into the distance.

reviews.reviewText: Lovely place to visit during monsoon. A rock formation that resembles elephant's head.

This place should be in the must go list while in Mahabaleshwar, the views are just great and the sunset is also astonishing, bit far from the town and also had to track a bit and ok once reached the point, felt like it was a worth to try.
A very good place to take photos and click selfies..
One of the best points to visit in Mahabaleshwar.

The views looks like elephant head .
It becomes more attractive and beautiful in rainy time.
It is actually nature of beauty.

‚ÄúBeautiful viewpoint with a natural rock that looks exactly like an elephant‚Äôs head. Stunning views of the valley and Sahyadri ranges, best around evening. Free entry, peaceful spot, and great for photos. A must-visit in Mahabaleshwar!‚Äù

Lovely scenery and veiw of mountains. Different types of flora and fauna. Must visit nature lovers. One km walking distance from parking area. Stalls of water and snacks available. Be away from monkeys. You will see different types of flowers on the way. Carry Umbrella with you.

Worth going there . View from there is absolutely beautiful best time to go there jst before sunrise bt u can go anytime and can enjoy the view. Strawberry ice cream is a must try there and u can even enjoy  several other dishes

Good scenic view over the high mountain n rocks. The rock resembles the head n nose of an elephant. The way towards the viewpoint is bit muddy but when you reach view points its beauty on earth. You can enjoy the chats stall items, cotton candy and please beware of monkeys there. They will be there but can snatch your items if you are carrying a polybag.

lephant's Head Point is the most picturesque viewpoints of Mahabaleshwar ,the overhanging cliffs of this point is similar to the head of an elephant and its trunk.Not a sight to be missed and has its treats along the walking trail with plenty of monkeys. Beautiful place and would definitely recommended.

sources.snippet: Known as the "Queen of All Points", Arthur Seat Point is one of the most famous and mesmerizing viewpoints in Mahabaleshwar. Perched at an altitude of 1,470 meters, this stunning spot offers breathtaking panoramic views of the deep valleys, the Savitri River, and the surrounding rugged mountains. Everyone knows that Mahabaleshwar is recognised for its British influence as much as it is for its strawberries. Almost every tourist point is named after a British officer who either liked hunting in the region or had a tragic experience on one of its cliffs.

sources.snippet: Wilson Point‚Äôs spectacular 360-degree vistas make it the ideal location for dramatic music videos or exquisite landscape photography. Imagine having an endless sky and rolling hills as the backdrop for your pre-wedding photos. This place is perfect for establishing shots and beautiful drone footage for vloggers.

Wilson point is the only real location in Mahabaleshwar wherever both sunrise and sunset may be seen. It supplies a spectacular glance of Mahabaleshwar in eve...

sources.snippet: Key attractions : Wilson Point also known as Sunrise Point, is the highest point in Mahabaleshwar at 1439 m. Wilson point is the only point in Mahabaleshwar where both sunrise and sunset can be seen. This point is named after Sir Leslie Wilson, the Governor of Bombay province.
sources.shortName: Things To Do | Exclusive Mahabaleshwar Site (2025)

sources.snippet: You are also able to take a panoramic glimpse of Mahabaleshwar from this vantage point. This place is popular among nature lovers and shutterbugs. You can take beautiful pics of yourself with beautiful nature.
sources.shortName: Top Tourist Destinations to Visit in Mahabaleshwar

sources.snippet: The Wilson Point is convenient to get to, you do not have to do much walking as it is close to the main road. From this point, it is best to watch the sunrise in the morning.
sources.shortName: 20 Breathtaking Places to Visit in Mahabaleshwar

sources.snippet: Standing at 4,710 feet above sea level, Wilson Point is the highest point in Mahabaleshwar and has three watchtowers, each opening up to splendid scenic landscapes.

sources.snippet: The natural grandeur of this hill station can be explored at Arthur‚Äôs Seat, Elephant's Head Point, Babington Point, Lodwick Point, and Wilson Point.
sources.shortName: 26 Best Places to Visit in Mahabaleshwar

placeMetadata.description: Popular mountaintop vista point offering panoramic views of both sunrises & sunsets.
placeMetadata.generatedDescription: Nestled in the heart of Mahabaleshwar, Rutba Villa is an ideal retreat for travelers seeking breathtaking views and a serene atmosphere. This charming accommodation offers easy access to popular attractions like Wilson Point, where visitors can marvel at stunning sunrises over the Sahyadri Hills. The area is rich with natural beauty, featuring highlights such as Arthur Seat, Lingmala Falls, and Venna Lake.
placeMetadata.address: Near by market 1km Near by venna lake 2km, near by Wilson point 1km, Maharashtra 412806, India

reviews.reviewText: Very good place, very silent and safe for family. Horse riding is a must. Cost would be around 200 to 300

Sunrise Point in Mahabaleshwar is an absolutely magical spot to start your day. Watching the sun rise over the lush green valleys and mountains is a breathtaking experience. The peaceful atmosphere, fresh air, and panoramic views make it perfect for nature enthusiasts and photographers. Arrive early to soak in the serene beauty and capture stunning moments. Highly recommended for anyone visiting Mahabaleshwar!

Amazing place to visit during after monsoons end. Although you won't be able to see sunrise during monsoon season but you will be able to touch the clouds üòù. This is what heaven might look like. A must visit place and enjoy the lush green fields and mountains view.

Simple place with good view of valley and jungle. 5:30 am is best to visit in may month. Not so cold or hot. Single vehicle route at the top. There are 2 view points at the top. Road is being constructed for two lane, one at each side. Good for morning walk.Safe too.

Wilson point is a visual treat for both sunset and sunrise. If you are a professional photographer than this place is a must come for you. The lush greenery and long distance landscape for taking pictures is what makes this point photographers paradise. Make sure you come before 5pm otherwise tourist cars flock this place and you wont be able to get parking. Though if you have driver than you can ask him to park car away and recall after visiting this point. Overall a very chilling place in evening to end you day with calm and peace and the wind blows out of proportion during monsoon, so be careful with kids.

Perfect place for a sunsrise. There are two big circular place constructed on top of the mountain to have a perfect view of the sunrise. The place is Serene and lush green. It gets bit difficult to reach this place as Google maps shows a path which goeas through a private property which ends going further. So better to follow sign boards available on the road.
If you want to spot a perfect location to view sunrise better reach the place by 6:15. If you reach late, the place will get crowded and will get difficult to find a spot to view sunrise.

Amazing place with lush green scenary spread as far as one can see. Awesome place to visit during monsoons and after monsoons till Jan. Although you won't be able to see sunrise in monsoon bit it is definitely worth a visit. This is what heaven might look like. Try it out.

This is one of the most famous sunrise point at Mahabaleshwar die to it flat land at the top of the mountain. You get a nice high rise point which gives you great view of the entire landscape. Try going there in Winters to have fog complimenting the sunrise..  otherwise it open all the time. A small treacherous road to reach this point and then a flat land.

placeMetadata.name: Lodwick Point

sources.snippet: Morarji Castle, the architecture made in British Style attracts the visitors with its beautiful structure, statues, and gardens. The place is popular for its historical significance; the father of the nation, Mahatma Gandhi had spend a little time at this castle while his visit to Mahabaleshwar.
sources.shortName: Best Places to Visit in Mahabaleshwar

sources.snippet: Key attractions : Lodwick Point area has 2 points in total viz Lodwick Point and Elephant Head Point. General Lodwick was the first British officer to climb the hill. To honour General Lodwick's achievement, his son erected a memorial pole of about 25 ft.

sources.snippet: Lodwick Point which lies 5 km to the west of Mahabaleshwar is a vantage point which provides an unmatched view of Pratapgarh Fort and Elphinstone Point. There is a huge statue of Lord Lodwick situated on the site.
sources.shortName: 31 Best Places to visit in Mahabaleshwar | Top Tourist Attractions

sources.snippet: A visit to the Lodwick Point presents tourists with two experiences: a long walk and bedazzling views of the hills. It is situated close to the market area, so you do not have to travel far to get here.
sources.shortName: 20 Breathtaking Places to Visit in Mahabaleshwar

sources.snippet: At a distance of 4 km from Mahabaleshwar Bus Stand, Lodwick Point is previously known as Sydney Point. This point lies at an elevation of 4087 feet above sea level.
sources.shortName: 27 Best Places to Visit in Mahabaleshwar, Things to Do & Sightseeing (2024)

sources.snippet: Named on the memory of Lord Lodwick, this is also one of those picturesque points to visit in Mahabaleshwar. However, beware of Monkeys when you are here.
sources.shortName: 15 Stunning Places To Visit In Mahabaleshwar You Should Visit If Youre A Nature Lover

sources.snippet: The natural grandeur of this hill station can be explored at Arthur‚Äôs Seat, Elephant's Head Point, Babington Point, Lodwick Point, and Wilson Point.
sources.shortName: 26 Best Places to Visit in Mahabaleshwar

placeMetadata.description: A wooded path leads to this mountain clearing popular for sunset views across hills & valleys.
placeMetadata.generatedDescription: Lodwick Point, formerly known as Sydney Point, is a picturesque mountain clearing located about 5 kilometers from Mahabaleshwar's central market. Named after Colonel General Lodwick, the first European to ascend this hill in 1824, it offers stunning sunset views across hills and valleys.
placeMetadata.address: WJQM+QWJ, Lodwick Trail, Haroshi, Dare, Maharashtra 412806, India

reviews.reviewText: A beautiful breathtaking view. Excellent spot. Easily accessible. Beautiful natural environment. Very clean and we'll maintained. Lovely place to visit.

There is some Road Construction work going on and hence you need to Walk for around 3 kilometres to reach there. But I would advise to take that effort because the view and the scenery it offer at the end is awesome. In the middle you can find some small shops  for your refreshment needs. And can also enjoy Horse riding here. Ahead of this pont is the famous Elephant point or the Needle point which is also worth visiting

I honestly can‚Äôt express my feelings ‚Äî the experience is on another level. The fresh air at the top of the mountains, combined with the breathtaking view of the river and mountain range, is something you have to feel in person. Absolutely magical and a must-visit spot

The newly constructed concrete road is not enough to pass 2 sedan cars in opposite direction. This cause heavy traffic & we got to drive in reverse for almost 3kms.
One of the cars was almost went down the lane (the lane is 1 feet steep on both sides)
Tourists have to be more cautious taking this route, I highly recommend NO to this spot having this road.
Visited on 8/05/2025. Great view.you have to walk for 10/15 minutes to reach the point. Elephant head point is 100 meters ahead. It has also great view.

As a scenic location, this is among the best in Mahabaleshwar. But all the fun is spoiled because of the extremely narrow road leading to the point (up to the parking area that barely accommodates 10 cars, beyond which you must walk). The cement road is narrow and elevated about a foot from ground. You have to drive carefully to avoid either to stop the left wheel from going off the road into the ditch, or rubbing the vehicles coming from the other side. If you are traveling in an expensive car, it's best to avoid this place.

It's one of the best points in Mahabaleshwar , compared to other points it has always less public there which is good , big cars have problem on road cause road is built new and they made edges on sides , at some places roads are too narrow than even two cars can't fit....

It was a beautiful view from the point.
The parking is approximately 800 to 900 meters away from the point so you have to walk for like 15 min but the road is great so that's not a problem and both the lodwick point and elephant point are close to each other just like 200 meters distance but elephant point has a greater view of the valley.‚ù§Ô∏è

placeMetadata.name: Dhobi Waterfall

sources.snippet: A fascinating sight to behold, the Dhobi Waterfall is of the one-day sightseeing places to visit in Mahabaleshwar. Being a lesser-known attraction in the city, the place is quite secluded giving you solace in the lap of nature. This waterfall is located around 3 Km away from the Mahabaleshwar bus stand making it well connected and convenient to reach.
sources.shortName: 20 Places to Visit in Mahabaleshwar in One Day: 2025

sources.snippet: Dhobi Waterfall is placed facing the famous Elphinstone Point. The waterfall is enclosed on all sides with rocks and the water drops down into the Mahabaleshwar Valley and finally meets the Koyna River. Set amidst lush green valley, the fall is a perfect picnic spot to spend a fun-filled day with family and friends.
sources.shortName: 27 Best Places to Visit in Mahabaleshwar, Things to Do & Sightseeing (2024)

sources.snippet: Located 3 kilometers away from the city, Dhobi waterfall is a prized jewel of Mahabaleshwar. Dhobi Falls is situated along the Petit road and Old Mahabaleshwar road. It connects the stunning vantage points such as Lodwick and Elphinstone's point.
sources.shortName: 26 Best Places to Visit in Mahabaleshwar

sources.snippet: Dhobi Falls are seated 3 km from the main Mahabaleshwar town and make for an idyllic attraction with loved ones!. It is a group of waterfalls connecting Lodwick and Elphinston points, further joining Petit road with Old Mahabaleshwar road.
sources.shortName: 43 Places to Visit in Mahabaleshwar in 2024

sources.snippet: Dhobi Waterfall, located less than 3 km from Mahabaleshwar‚Äôs main city. A waterfall for all the fun lovers and picnic seekers has always been a very attractive place.
sources.shortName: Best Places to Visit in Mahabaleshwar

sources.snippet: Located just beside the forest Bungalow of Lingmala, the waterfalls provides a view of the beautiful Dhobi Waterfall as well as Chinaman's Waterfall.
sources.shortName: 31 Best Places to visit in Mahabaleshwar | Top Tourist Attractions

placeMetadata.description: This sizable waterfall dramatically cascading amid lush surrounds is a popular scenic destination.
placeMetadata.generatedDescription: Nestled in the heart of Mahabaleshwar, Dhobi Waterfall is a stunning natural wonder that captivates visitors with its dramatic cascade and lush surroundings. This picturesque waterfall offers breathtaking views, making it an essential stop for anyone exploring the area. The water flows gracefully into the valley before merging with the Koyna River, creating a mesmerizing sight that outdoor enthusiasts and nature lovers simply cannot miss.

reviews.reviewText:
One of the breathtaking views in Mahabaleshwar. The small treking of 15 to 20 min was a beautiful experience.There is waterfall to attractions with a foggy view!
You have to walk into the woods to see it.
It's amazing experience.üòçüëåüèª

Went to the Dhobi waterfall on recommendation of a local person and it was a palce which is not so easily accessible., can visit once.Nice place to enjoy, bath and relax with family
Enjoyed a lot and felt fresh and energetic after taking a bath in this water fall. Nice scenic beauty and calm environment.Mini waterfall
Though the fall is not from much height, but still enjoyed a lot visiting this place as it was very peaceful. One can go in the middle of the water and enjoy.

Helen's point, also referred to as the Blue valley and is noted for its scenic beauty dotted by small huts, deep valleys and cascading waterfalls. Krishna river flowing through the heart of the area is the main attraction along with Robbers cave, Gavalani point and North Coat point.
The place was good but I did not Find anyl government people available there.

Google location cannot show correctly. It says you have reached but at surrounding you can see only high height trees. Road in Mahabaleshwar are so beautiful due to forest on both side you can feel so beautiful while driving on these roads. Every where greenery...
Really great if you are allowed to enter the water it's almost like a mini Bushi Dam considering the steps/stairs on the Dhobi Dam at the top

It's awesome place for weekend fun with your friends and family... It's too good place..  Natural beauty...  Greenery.. Water fall... Western ghat...  Good place..  Water falls is too good..  Terrain..  Cold weather...  Good morning Fogg..  Good nature..  Greener..  Forest..  Greenery..  Good atmosphere..  Good place..
No view of waterfall. Need to walk alot and at the end you won't get much.

Perched at an altitude of 1,470 meters, this stunning spot offers breathtaking panoramic views of the deep valleys, the Savitri River, and the surrounding rugged mountains. What makes this location unique is its floating effect, if you throw light objects like a cap or paper, they appear to float due to the air pressure difference.

sources.snippet: Upon reaching the hill station with my family, we left for a quick drive to Sunset Point, hoping to catch a glimpse of the setting sun. However, on our way, we found a board pointing towards a narrow lane with ‚ÄòWilson Point‚Äô written on it. Everyone knows that Mahabaleshwar is recognised for its British influence as much as it is for its strawberries.
sources.shortName: 6 Picture-Perfect Spots in Mahabaleshwar

sources.snippet: You have the opportunity to glance at the panoramic Mahabaleshwar from the comfort point, and it's known to be the favorite amongst photographers and nature lovers. Don‚Äôt forget to carry your DigiCam to capture some awesome snaps. This point is also known as the Sunrise Point.
sources.shortName: Best Places to Visit in Mahabaleshwar

sources.snippet: Key attractions : Sunset Point is one of the most popular points of Mahabaleshwar. Sunset Point is also popularly known as Mumbai Point** or Bombay Point. The Mumbai Point is the oldest point of Mahabaleshwar.
sources.shortName: Things To Do | Exclusive Mahabaleshwar Site (2025)

placeMetadata.description: This bustling, landmark scenic overlook offers concessions, horseback rides & sunsets.
placeMetadata.generatedDescription: Mumbai Sunset Point, also referred to as Bombay Point, is a must-visit scenic overlook located about 5 kilometers from the bustling heart of Mahabaleshwar. This iconic spot offers breathtaking views of the sun setting over the lush valleys below, making it a favorite among both locals and tourists. Originally known as Sydney Point, this picturesque location was named after Colonel General Lodwick, who first ascended these hills in 1824 with his military team and local guides.

reviews.reviewText: A stunning sunset view paired with the cool breeze gives you a refreshing feeling in summer. Visit this area to experience the beauty of nature and enjoy some fast food while watching the sun go down.

Amazing place, better to go around 6 p.m. so that u can enjoy the games stall over there and tea snacks. Around 6:30 p.m. one can enjoy the sunset moment. There is shop of gaming that person is amazing we went there to play one game but we played around 9 to 10 games. Highly recommend that shop for games.

üåÑ Mumbai Point (Sunset Point), Mahabaleshwar ‚Äì A Timeless Sunset Experience
Mumbai Point, also known as Sunset Point or Bombay Point, is one of Mahabaleshwar‚Äôs most iconic and oldest viewpoints. Situated along the historic Old Bombay Road, this spot offers a breathtaking panorama of the sun setting over the Sahyadri hills, casting vibrant hues across the sky. It's a favorite among photographers and nature enthusiasts seeking to capture the mesmerizing transition of day into night

If you visit this place during monsoon, you might be a little disappointed cuz as the name suggests sunset point there will be nothing to see except fog and cool breeze.
But it is a good place to click pictures and spend time with family and if you wanna ride a horse you can sit on one.
You will get food items like corn, onion pakodas, maggie, tea and lots of stuff here, the road towards this point is a little narrow but you can manage to drive if you are experienced.
Overall if you visit this place in winter season i think it will be worth it more than monsoon season.

Amazing,
Sunset,
Horse Riding,
kullad Chay and Corn Pakoda
Great time to spend mostly on evening

Best time to interact with nature particularly the Sun set time
Enjoyed were much with lots of visitors and tourist around

This is quite a good spot to enjoy sunset. You can enjoy horse riding here (I won't recommend being an animal concerned person). If you love being at a little crowded place and enjoy the sunset. This is a place for you. But if you love to enjoy sunset at silence this might not be the ideal spot for it. For that you need to stop your car at a random place where you get the perfect view away from the crowd. Cheers!!
Lovely point, however it should be organised better for convenient public viewing!

placeMetadata.name: Babington Point

sources.snippet: Babington Point holds the appreciation to be one of the best places for honeymooners along with nature lovers. It's at an elevation of 1200 meters above the sea level and overlooks the luxurious emerald ountain ranges. The astounding views of Solshi and Koyna Valleys in addition to the glittering view of Chinaman‚Äôs Falls is a treat to watch from here.

sources.snippet: Babington Point in Mahabaleshwar is famous for the splendid view it offers of the Chinaman Waterfall and the densely covered mountain ranges. It is a favourite amongst trekkers and nature lovers.

placeMetadata.description: Lookout point in the hills above Mahabaleshwar offering vistas of the surrounding countryside.
placeMetadata.generatedDescription: Babington Point, formerly known as Sydney Point, is a scenic lookout located about 5 kilometers from the central market of Mahabaleshwar. Named after Colonel General Lodwick, it offers stunning vistas of the surrounding countryside and is a popular spot for nature lovers and wildlife enthusiasts. Visitors can enjoy panoramic views of Chinaman Waterfalls and Saddleback, along with lush forested hills.
placeMetadata.address: WM54+GGR, Tapola Rd, Birwadi, Maharashtra 412806, India

reviews.reviewText: On the side there is a small walkway that lead to a small hamlet. Follow that path and even before the hamlet, there is a small walkway that goes inside the forest. Where the forest clears up, you get a breathtaking view of the China main falls in a distance. Nice place to spend some time and also have a small picnic.

This is kind of a deserted point. When we went there no tourists were there apart from us. Some local people were hanging out in there with loud music and food. This point might be good in rains but normally its just a regular sitting place with not so good view.

Not a point with great view but has lot of tree cover and a good place to sit and chill with friends, family. It‚Äôs remote and there are very few tourists so good for people who love the tranquility. Would not recommend to go after late evening specially for women as it‚Äôs a deserted place.
Surrounding atmosphere is pleasant. Dense forest and quiet area. I loved the place. But view point is fully covered with trees, valley is not at all visible.

Trees are blocking the valley view so many people avoid this point.
If you are looking for a less crowded place to click your photos then this is a nice spot, otherwise avoid.
As the trees blocking the view there is no view of the valley. Its better to head to Tapola point rather than stopping here.

After reaching the point go down wards from the side path having a walk time to the 6-7 mins there.
You will surely enjoy the scenically view around the three sides of mountains.

An off beat picnic spot in Mahabaleswar, which you may not find out so easily. From the point where there is a sign board and tarred road ends, just trek down straight for around 2kms through a jungle like trail. You will reach an open space, from where you can have a very beautiful panoramic view of the vast expanse around. Chinaman waterfalls, a beautiful cascading falls can be seen from here better with the help of Binoculars or can be snapped elegantly by a camera with telephoto lens.

placeMetadata.name: Falkland Point

sources.snippet: If you wish to spend a weekend amongst the flora and fauna, then you cannot miss out on the Chinaman‚Äôs Falls, Sunset Point, Falkland Point, and Dhobi Falls, on the contrary, if you wish to add a tinge of excitement to your Mahabaleshwar vacations, then you can try your hands in go-karting, horse riding, or indulge in the various activities at the Velocity Entertainmentz. Lying in the Sahyadri Range, this place is one of the top places on the traveler‚Äôs list.

sources.snippet: Falkland Point is located close to Bombay Point and the Carnac Point. The highlight of this place are the light woods surrounding this point. It's named after Sir Falkland, who was the Governor of Bombay Presidency during Colonial Era.
sources.shortName: Best Places to Visit in Mahabaleshwar

placeMetadata.generatedDescription: Falkland Point, named after Sir Falkland, the Governor of Bombay Presidency during the British colonial era, is a popular one-day sightseeing destination in Mahabaleshwar. Surrounded by light woods and located near Bombay Point and Carnac Point, it offers stunning natural vistas of the Koyna Valley. This hidden gem provides a tranquil escape amidst lush greenery, offering a serene experience for nature enthusiasts.

reviews.reviewText: Falkland Point unfolds a magical world full of blissful natural vistas.This famous spot offers wonderful views of the beautiful Koyna Valley and the splendid Makarandgad Fort. What adds to its charm is the open space from where one can admire the unique beauty of Mahabaleshwar's hilly terrain.

This place is the same as other viewpoints in Mahabaleshwar, Mahabaleshwar is all mountains so in every corner, there is a viewpoint, nothing special about this point.Falkland Point unfolds a magical world full of blissful natural vistas.This famous spot offers wonderful views of the beautiful Koyna Valley and the splendid Makarandgad Fort. What adds to its charm is the open space from where one can admire the unique beauty of Mahabaleshwar's hilly terrain.
Somebody put it as a joke. This place isn‚Äôt there I think. However the places near that are amazing

Ah, Fakland Point in Mahabaleshwar! It's a hidden gem that offers a unique and tranquil experience for nature lovers. Located amidst the lush greenery of Mahabaleshwar, Fakland Point provides a serene escape from the hustle and bustle of city life.

From Fakland Point, you can witness the breathtaking beauty of the Sahyadri mountain range and the surrounding valleys. The panoramic view is absolutely mesmerizing, especially during sunrise and sunset when the sky is painted with vibrant colors.

What sets Fakland Point apart is its peaceful atmosphere and the opportunity to connect with nature. It's a perfect spot for a leisurely picnic or to simply sit back and soak in the natural beauty. The cool breeze, the chirping of birds, and the scent of fresh flowers create a soothing ambiance that rejuvenates the soul.

To reach Fakland Point, you can take a short hike through the picturesque trails surrounded by dense forests. The journey itself is an adventure, allowing you to immerse yourself in the tranquility of nature.

If you're a photography enthusiast, Fakland Point offers ample opportunities to capture stunning shots of the picturesque landscapes. It's a place where you can truly appreciate the beauty of nature and create lasting memories.

So, if you're seeking a peaceful retreat and a chance to reconnect with nature, Fakland Point in Mahabaleshwar is definitely worth a visit! üå≥üåÑ
No such point from polo ground. The route displayed by google doesn't exist
Nice place. It was chilling there when we go. Natural beauty

Mahabaleshwar¬†is a small town aIndia. It is a place of pilgrimage for Hindus because¬†Krishna river

Panchaganga temple in Old Mahabaleshwar, 1850s

In¬†old Mahabaleshwar, 7¬†km from Mahabaleshwar, there are many tourist points and 5 temples to see, with examples of old Indian architecture. There are also natural view points, some of them named by the 19th-century British¬†colonial rulers.

Krishnabai temple

Behind Panchganga temple, there is a small trail that leads to Krishnabai temple believed to be the source of the river. It is built on the hilltop overlooking the Krishna valley and was built in 1888.The temple has a¬†Shiva lingam¬†and a statue of Krishna. A small stream of the flowing from a sculpture shaped as a mouth of a cow(gomukh) falls on in a 'Kunda' or water tank. Stone carved columns and ceilings are the special characteristics of this temple. This old temple has gathered moss and is in ruins.Given its isolated spot, the temple is visited by only a few tourists, however, it provides a most exquisite view of the river Krishna.

Arthur point

A view from Arthur seat point

This geographical point is named after British Officer Sir Arthur Malet (1806‚Äì1888).

Venna Lake

Boats on the¬†Venna lake¬†in Mahabaleshwar.

The¬†Venna lake¬†is one of the tourist attractions of Mahabaleshwar.[31]¬†The lake is surrounded by trees.

3 Monkey Point

placeMetadata.name: Sunrise point Mahabaleshwar

sources.snippet: Known as the "Queen of All Points", Arthur Seat Point is one of the most famous and mesmerizing viewpoints in Mahabaleshwar. Perched at an altitude of 1,470 meters, this stunning spot offers breathtaking panoramic views of the deep valleys, the Savitri River, and the surrounding rugged mountains. What makes this location unique is its floating effect, if you throw light objects like a cap or paper, they appear to float due to the air pressure difference.
sources.shortName: Top 20 Places to visit in Mahabaleshwar

sources.snippet: Wilson Point is the best point in Mahabaleshwar at 1439 m., named following Sir Leslie Wilson, the governor of Bombay from 1923¬ñ26. Wilson point is the only real location in Mahabaleshwar wherever both sunrise and sunset may be seen. It supplies a spectacular glance of Mahabaleshwar in eve...
sources.shortName: 40 Places To Visit In Mahabaleshwar For The Holiday Of A Lifetime

placeMetadata.generatedDescription: Sunrise Point Mahabaleshwar, also known as Wilson Point, is the highest point in Mahabaleshwar at an altitude of 4735 ft above sea level. It offers a unique and magical experience for visitors eager to witness the sunrise and sunset over the Sahyadri Hills. Named after Sir Leslie Wilson, this picturesque plateau features three masonry platforms for convenient viewing.

reviews.reviewText:
The experience at Sunrise Point is enhanced by the cool mountain air and serene atmosphere. As the sun rises, the sky transforms into a canvas of colors, creating a magical effect that captivates visitors.
The area around the point is surrounded by lush greenery, making it ideal for nature walks and photography
Its breathtaking panoramic views and stunning sunrises. The viewpoint features three watchtowers that provide visitors with unique perspectives of the surrounding valleys and landscapes.
There is no charge to enter Sunrise Point, making it accessible to all visitors.
The site is open all day, but the best time to visit is between 6:00 AM and 8:00 PM. For sunrise viewing, it is recommended to arrive by 5:45 AM during summer season.

The approach to this spot is through a narrow road and walkway, both flanked by dense, lush green forest. Thanks to continuous rainfall, the path is often covered with algae, making the walk slightly slippery but also thrilling‚Äîespecially for nature lovers. Early mornings are the best time to visit, as the cool breeze and peaceful ambiance create the perfect setting for watching the sunrise.

While the view during other times of the day may not be as captivating, the surrounding landscape of rolling green hills still offers a refreshing break from city life.

Entry is completely free, and there‚Äôs no charge for parking, though space is quite limited. The location is approximately 8 kilometers from the town, making it a quick and scenic getaway.

The view of the sunrise is mind-blowing. We waited for almost half an hour for the sun to rise and the wait was worth it. On that day we have not sleeped for almost a day and were too sleepy as we dropped that night from Mumbai to mahabaleshwar. Instead of the sleepy head we decided to watch the sunrise. And this experience was worth it. We sat down at a perfect place and the weather was very pleasant,the wind was nice and cold and was pleasenty flowing , there was a positive vibe in the atmosphere. The air was very fresh and we loved watching the sunrise.

Good view. Reached early before sunrise and it was worth it.
Road can be a bit tricky.
There are 2 roads to reach , only 1 has driveable road to top.
There are multiple points here and can be visited for sunset as well.
Experience was quite good.  But weather was not right.  Due to fog and clouds I couldn't watch sunrise. But other than that weather was perfect, little foggy cold breeze. Perfect....

Wilson point is the highest point in Mahabaleshwar, but we went in mid-june during rainy season. Clouds were flying all around us and due to heavy fog we couldn't see the Sunrise properly. However, I am sure during normal weather,views would be really great.

Being sunrise point this Location is best captured in Evening as you can have pictures in Moon light.Also Known as Wilson's Point and Green carpet of mountain can be seen from this location, as it is on the Top of Mahableshwar.
Went in 1st week of aug....ws raining heavily... different view of cliff and weather. It was too windy and raining heavily... not wht is expected from a sunrise point but worth...

placeMetadata.name: Venna Lake & Dam

sources.snippet: A tranquil escape surrounded by lush greenery, Venna Dam is one of the top attractions in Mahabaleshwar, known for its serene atmosphere and stunning views. Built in 1942, this dam serves as a vital water source for the region while also offering a picturesque setting for visitors to relax and unwind. The adjacent Venna Lake is a major highlight, where tourists can enjoy boating, horse riding, and lakeside strolls.
sources.shortName: Top 20 Places to visit in Mahabaleshwar

sources.snippet: At a distance of 3 km from Mahabaleshwar Bus Stand, Venna Lake is a manmade lake situated in Mahabaleshwar. It is one of the popular tourist places in Mahabaleshwar.
sources.shortName: 27 Best Places to Visit in Mahabaleshwar, Things to Do & Sightseeing (2024)

placeMetadata.description: Well-known lake in lush surrounds offering boating, fishing, horseback riding & food vendors.
placeMetadata.generatedDescription: Venna Lake & Dam is a popular manmade lake located in Mahabaleshwar, about 3 km from the Mahabaleshwar Bus Stand. It's surrounded by lush greenery and offers various activities such as boating, fishing, and horseback riding. Visitors can rent rowing or paddling boats to enjoy the scenic views of the lake.
placeMetadata.address: WMM9+QFQ, Panchgani - Mahabaleshwar Rd, Mahabaleshwar, Maharashtra 412806, India

reviews.reviewText: Awesome view during winter evening and experiance with paddle boat ride is great with friends and family.

It was a nice experience. We did a boat ride over there. Lake view is really beautiful.

Boat ride rates:
1. Paddle boat :
2.  Row boat : 400 per boat/30 mins,800  per boat/1 hr(max 7 pax)
3. Row boat with driver : 600 per boat/30 mins,1200  per boat/1 hr(max 6 pax)

Timing: 8 am to 8 pm

A top attraction in Mahabaleshwar is boating on the lake. You can choose between a self-rowing/paddle boat for 1 hour at ‚Çπ600 (plus a ‚Çπ2000 refundable deposit) or a guided boat ride (up to 7 people) for ‚Çπ600 for 15-20 minutes or ‚Çπ1200 for 40 minutes. I suggest the self-paddle boat for an hour to enjoy stunning views, especially at sunset.
It's was new year eve and my birthday,  witnessed  the last sunset  of 2023. It was crowded and long queue  for boat ride as it was the occasion  of new year. Enjoyed  the view of the lake and sunset

One of the best place to visit while in Mahabaleshwar. Huge crowd observed.Boating,horse riding facilities available. Lots of etable stalls are there.Very healthy cool atmosphere .Services are good.Lot of space for pay and park.You can heartily enjoy this place.Must visit place.

Awesome experience!! Such a nice lake and view to enjoy with family. They offered peddle and rowing boat. We opted for rowing which was charged for 400 for 30min for individual boat which is not shared with others and a man would be there to row the boat. Cool place and nice atmosphere!!

Boating people keep pestering us to buy a ride. The ticket window people do not take online payments and do not answer questions making it easier for new people to get confused and buy the wrong boat rides with higher fees. Horses made a lot of mess in parking so it was difficult to walk .

Venna Lake is constructed artificially over an area of 28 acres. The periphery of the lake is about 7-8 km long. This lake is not only famous among tourists but it is also famous among pilgrims. About one-third of the lake is meant for pilgrimage.

The lake offers amazing boating facilities and horse rides to the tourists. Venna Lake has a lot to offer to nature lovers as well. The lake is surrounded by lush green Chhatrapati Pratapsinh gardens. If you want to spend your evening in a peaceful setting of the adjacent Chhatrapati Pratapsinh garden, you can come to this place and take part in a number of activities as well as relish the local food in more than a few nearby food joints.

placeMetadata.name: Chinaman Waterfall

sources.snippet: Your trip to Mahabaleshwar shall be incomplete if you miss out on the Chinaman Waterfall. This spectacular place is a Mecca for every Photographers and Insta-addicts.
sources.shortName: 15 Stunning Places To Visit In Mahabaleshwar You Should Visit If Youre A Nature Lover

placeMetadata.generatedDescription: Chinaman Waterfall is a must-see attraction in Mahabaleshwar, drawing photographers and social media enthusiasts alike. The waterfall offers a spectacular sight and is a popular spot for capturing stunning photographs.

sources.snippet: Filmmakers frequently choose Bombay Point for establishing shots since it provides amazing vistas of the surrounding hills and valleys. This gorgeous setting is ideal for grandiose pre-wedding portraits, expansive landscape shots, or vlogs that highlight Mahabaleshwar‚Äôs splendor from an alternative viewpoint.

sources.snippet: Also called sunset point, it is the oldest point in the hill station and derives its name from its location near the old Bombay road. The point is a checklist item on places to visit in Mahabaleshwar.

Located on the old road to Mumbai, it attracts numerous visitors seeking breathtaking views of the city. This picturesque spot is adored by nature enthusiasts and provides an ideal setting for capturing stunning photographs.

reviews.reviewText: Nice place

placeMetadata.name: market PURE

sources.snippet: The vibrant Mahabaleshwar Market, featured in Lootcase, as a great setting for pre-wedding photos or a vlog that explores the local retail scene. Imagine filming unguarded moments of vloggers enjoying some delectable street food or couples haggling over souvenirs.
sources.shortName: 12 Mesmerizing Mahabaleshwar Locations for Your Next Shoot

placeMetadata.generatedDescription: When visiting Mahabaleshwar, a trip to the bustling Mahabaleshwar market is a must. Here, you can find an array of goods including footwear, strawberries, mulberries, chikki (a traditional Indian sweet), and chana. The market also features a unique wax museum where visually impaired individuals craft candles and physically impaired artisans create wax statues.

reviews.reviewText:
It's quite a good place for shopping and for roaming. It's a pay and park system there and no shade is provided.

No public restroom I found. Rates of toys and food are high.

We visited here twice on our trip to mahabaleshwar. The restaurant is one of the best pure vegetarian places nearby. The food is really delicious and the quality is good as well, plus the place is quite affordable. The staff is very helpful and courteous.
The restaurant location is also very good and they have good parking space.

Totally recommend the place!

Nothing that I'm interested im buying here as a backpacker tourist, more a market for the locals. Visiting a must how ever. From what I understand happening every Tuesday. Buy fish, tupperware, clothes, fruits and vegetables, spices and herbs etc. A nice way to kill 30-45 minutes when visiting Mahabaleshwar.

I recently visited Bagicha Restaurant in Mahabaleshwar, and it was a delightful experience! The ambiance is charming, adds to the overall vibe. The menu offers a great variety of dishes, and everything we ordered was flavorful and well-prepared.

The staff was friendly and attentive, making sure we had a pleasant dining experience. I particularly enjoyed their local specialties, which were a treat! The prices are reasonable too, making it a perfect spot for families and friends.

Overall, Bagicha Restaurant is a must-visit for anyone in Mahabaleshwar looking for good food in a beautiful setting. Highly recommended!"

We tried restaurant food here during our stay in Mahabaleshwar. It‚Äôs on main road.

Good North Indian food. Service is efficient. We tried following dishes

Manchow soup - tasty and loaded with veggies üëç
Butter Kulcha - looks like star dish here which goes with curries üëç was too good
Curry recommended by waiter - Veggies fried like kebab in gravy. Good üëç I think curry name was Patiala

Lovely experience... Quick service... welcoming staff... cleanliness is maintained...
Ghar jesa khana...we had kadhi khichdi, aaloo paratha... strawberry N chocolate cream..
I would like to visit again....

The most happening place of mahabaleshwar mostly after sunset. Since there are no other activities to do after it goes dark, everyone heads to the market area which has different vibes which you need to feel physically.

All types of shops and food trucks you can see selling delicious food, my favourites are strawberry icecream, sitafal icecream, milkshakes, Maggie, corn pakoda and what not.

Most of the time on the weekend it is crowded, but if you want to get things at a discounted rate go on weekdays.

Must visit place. Very yummy and delicious üòã food.
Recommend Order: Makkai cheese Frankie, Fresh strawberry with toppings.

Bagicha Corner in Mahabaleshwar offers a delightful culinary experience amidst a charming garden setting. During my visit, I savored the Makkai Cheese Frankie, Puri Bhaji, Aloo Paratha, and Makkai Sabzi with Roti. Each dish was flavorful and satisfying, with the Makkai Cheese Frankie standing out for its perfect blend of spices and cheesy goodness.

For dessert, I indulged in fresh strawberries with cream and a strawberry milkshake. The strawberries were fresh and sweet, complemented by the rich cream, making for a refreshing treat. The strawberry milkshake was equally delightful, capturing the essence of Mahabaleshwar's renowned strawberry produce.

The caf√©'s ambiance is enhanced by its beautiful garden, featuring a variety of flowers and strawberry plants in pots, creating a serene and picturesque environment. This natural setting adds to the overall dining experience, making it a must-visit spot for both food enthusiasts and nature lovers.

Bagicha Corner is also known for its strawberry-based desserts, which are a highlight for many visitors. The combination of delectable food and a tranquil garden setting makes it a memorable destination in Mahabaleshwar.

placeMetadata.name: Mahabaleshwar Hill Station

sources.shortName: 40 Places To Visit In Mahabaleshwar For The Holiday Of A Lifetime

placeMetadata.description: Gateway to Lingmala waterfall, Monkey Point & Venna Lake, with vendors selling locals strawberries.
placeMetadata.generatedDescription: Nestled in the Sahyadri Mountain ranges, south of Mumbai, Mahabaleshwar Hill Station is a hidden paradise with enchanting views and mystical landscapes. The town offers cool, pleasant weather year-round and spectacular vistas of lush green hills. Visitors can enjoy activities such as visiting Lingmala waterfall, Monkey Point, and Venna Lake while indulging in delicious strawberries from local vendors.

reviews.reviewText: Mahabaleshwar is a stunning hill station nestled in the Western Ghats of Maharashtra, known for its scenic beauty, lush greenery, and pleasant climate. A perfect escape from city life, it offers breathtaking viewpoints like Arthur‚Äôs Seat and Wilson Point, serene lakes like Vienna Lake, and historic sites such as the ancient Mahabaleshwar Temple. The strawberry farms add a sweet charm, making it a delight for fruit lovers. Ideal for nature lovers and families alike, Mahabaleshwar blends tranquility with adventure. Whether you're trekking, boating, or simply soaking in the views, this paradise promises a refreshing and memorable getaway. A must-visit destination!

We went to Mahabaleshwar hoping to enjoy the rainy season. Packed all our rain gear, umbrellas, jackets, even plastic covers for bags. But as soon as we reached‚Ä¶ the rain just disappeared! Not even a single drop! It was like the rain said, ‚ÄúOkay, my job is done. You guys take care now.‚Äù

Instead, we were welcomed by thick clouds everywhere. Couldn‚Äôt see much ahead while driving ‚Äì the fog was like ‚Äúpeekaboo!‚Äù every few minutes. But honestly, the cloudy weather made the whole place look magical. The valleys, trees, and hills covered in clouds looked straight out of a movie scene.

We missed the rain, but the cool weather and peaceful vibes made up for it. Sitting on a hilltop with hot chai and roasted corn in that fog‚Ä¶ pure bliss. It felt like the clouds came just to give us a cozy hug.

So yeah, Mahabaleshwar didn‚Äôt give us rain, but it gave us something better ‚Äî quiet, calm, and some unforgettable views. Highly recommend going there if you want a break from all the city noise. Just‚Ä¶ don‚Äôt chase the rain. It‚Äôs faster than it looks!

Amazing journey, must visit in monsoon. But avoid night driving, visibility is very low in night. Can't see even 20 meter ahead.
Otherwise it's just like experiencing heaven in monsoon.

Mahabaleshwar is truly a paradise for nature lovers and anyone looking to escape the chaos of city life. Surrounded by lush greenery, majestic mountains, and cool breezes, this hill station offers a perfect blend of scenic beauty and peaceful vibes.

The viewpoints like Arthur‚Äôs Seat, Elephant‚Äôs Head Point, and Wilson Point are breathtaking, offering stunning panoramic views of the valleys and rivers below. I especially loved the sunrise at Wilson Point ‚Äî it‚Äôs an experience you shouldn‚Äôt miss!

‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê
Beautiful Hill Station with Stunning Views!

Mahabaleshwar is one of the most scenic and peaceful getaways in Maharashtra. The cool climate, lush greenery, and panoramic viewpoints like Arthur‚Äôs Seat, Elephant‚Äôs Head Point, and Wilson Point make it a must-visit destination. The strawberry farms are a sweet bonus‚Äîdon‚Äôt miss trying the fresh strawberries with cream!

The town also has some beautiful temples and the historic Pratapgad Fort nearby for those interested in culture and history. Roads are well maintained, though it can get crowded during peak season.

Plenty of good food options and cozy stays. Overall, a perfect place to relax, explore, and enjoy nature!

Visit during monsoon. When we visited there were rains but not heavy downpours.

It should be drizzling not heavy rains, if there is heavy rain then the entire place is covered in fog, it would be difficult to drive in the fog in the hill station and also some view points will be closed.

Hotels, restaurants and taxi service , bus services are available within Mahabaleshwar and to reach as well multiple bus or cab services available.

Weekends will be too crowded, There are 3 temples at the hill top and they are a must visit.

Mahabaleshwar is pure bliss! From Arthur‚Äôs Seat to Wilson Point, every viewpoint offers breathtaking natural beauty, lush greenery, and peaceful hills. The cool weather and fresh mountain air make you feel alive. Local people are warm and helpful. Enjoy strawberries, local food, and serene nature‚Äîall at one of India‚Äôs finest hill stations!

üëå‚ú®Mahabaleshwar ‚Äì Monsoon Bliss in the Hills!
I visited Mahabaleshwar during the monsoon season, and it was one of the most refreshing experiences ever! The lush green hills covered in mist, cool breezy weather, and light drizzles made every moment magical. The clean, fresh mountain air instantly lifts your mood. Street food like hot corn, vada pav, and fresh strawberries made the rainy weather even more enjoyable. Local people are warm, polite, and always ready to help.

Driving through the winding ghats was thrilling with scenic valley views at every turn. Whether you're a nature lover, a couple looking for peace, or a photographer ‚Äî this place has something for everyone. The sound of waterfalls, the foggy viewpoints, and the calm vibes offer pure peace of mind.

Highly recommended for a monsoon getaway that‚Äôs full of nature, flavor, and soulful moments!...‚ú®üéä

placeMetadata.name: Polo Grounds

sources.snippet: The colonial-styled historic Polo Grounds provided the backdrop for the exciting dancing scenes in ABCD 2. This setting provides a distinctive fusion of modern and historical emotions, making it ideal for a funny pre-wedding photography, dancing music video, or interesting vlog about Malabaleshwar‚Äôs best-kept secrets.
sources.shortName: 12 Mesmerizing Mahabaleshwar Locations for Your Next Shoot

placeMetadata.address: WJ9V+J8X, Horse Riding, Mahabaleshwar, Maharashtra 412806, India

reviews.reviewText:
Beautiful place on hill top
Polo Ground is a place near a famous tourist attraction Bombay Point. You can reach the place by passing through a forest along Tiger Path. The place will be your cup of tea if you are open to long walks. This place provides excellent trails for those interested in trail tours. You can also enjoy sunset view at Bombay Point. which it is famous for.

Polo grounds is an open field very near to the MTDC Resort and off the Sunset Point Road. At the Mahad Toll Booth we have to take the left turn going downhill and the grounds are located about 1 km from the junction. The grounds are good for horse riding practice, trekking and bicycling. Many tourists bring their car here to teach their kids or friends driving as well. There is a helipad here too. Generally avoidable in the monsoon as the grounds become slushy. More local people play cricket here early in the morning. Polo is not so popular these days.
A quiet place and fun if you are interested in horse riding

This place is a hidden gem in mahablashwar. The only problem us that it is not we'll mantained and managed. There should be proper placing for horses and path should be set. They ride in all the ground due to this the grass in the ground is getting destroyed.
Been visiting for past 50 years. No trip to Mahabaleshwar is complete without a ride here
Horse lovers. You'll love it
To enjoy the real happiness of horse riding the polo ground is best place, but most of the people don't know .
Best place ever i have seen in my life in monsoon season... So peaceful and calm place

ops.insert: Lake recreation area with boats available to rent, horseback rides & carnival-style food stalls.
Popular mountaintop vista point offering panoramic views of both sunrises & sunsets.
A wooded path leads to this mountain clearing popular for sunset views across hills & valleys.
This sizable waterfall dramatically cascading amid lush surrounds is a popular scenic destination.
This bustling, landmark scenic overlook offers concessions, horseback rides & sunsets.
Lookout point in the hills above Mahabaleshwar offering vistas of the surrounding countryside.
Well-known lake in lush surrounds offering boating, fishing, horseback riding & food vendors.
Gateway to Lingmala waterfall, Monkey Point & Venna Lake, with vendors selling locals strawberries.
